snippet: The intrusion of valley fever into the career of Conor Jackson now resides somewhere in the background of the struggles of the Mets’ Ike Davis, who has the disease but has not exhibited symptoms.
abstract: Intrusion of valley fever into the career of Conor Jackson, who once was a regular fixture with the Arizona Diamondbacks but is now in the minor leagues, now resides somewhere in the background of the struggles of the New York Mets first baseman Ike Davis, who has the disease but has not exhibited symptoms.

byline.contributor: Nicholas Bakalar and Andrew Keh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The intrusion of valley fever into the career of Conor Jackson now resides somewhere in the background of the struggles of the Mets’ Ike Davis, who has the disease but has not exhibited symptoms.

headline.seo: Slumps of Conor Jackson and Ike Davis Have Some Parallels
headline.main: Two Profound Slumps, With Some Parallels
headline.print_headline: Two Profound Slumps, With Some Parallels
